title: Erdős Problem #3
description: If ... has ... then must ... contain arbitrarily long arithmetic progressions?

overview.historicalContext: Erdős Problem #3 from erdosproblems.com. Originally offered with a prize of $5000.
overview.problemStatement: If $A\subseteq \mathbb{N}$ has $\sum_{n\in A}\frac{1}{n}=\infty$ then must $A$ contain arbitrarily long arithmetic progressions?
